channel.title: Adding New Index to File Server
channel.description: Ok, so I've added a new index to my cache to load all textures for my client and i have it loading fine client sided. Its also being loaded in the file server too. The problem is when I delete my cache and go to download a fresh one, it downloads and loads fine up to the login screen. When you hit login its stuck at "Please allow a few moments for the region to download." I can't figure out why this is happening. I've packed the crc and versionlist for the index in versionlist.dat and i've found that Texture.java is communicating with it through ondemand found here: [code=java]updateManager.method558(4, id);[/code] which requests files as 4 is the newest data block. If anyone could help me figure this out, i'd forever be in your favor. :D

item.title: Adding New Index to File Server
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

Ok, so I’ve added a new index to my cache to load all textures for my client and i have it loading fine client sided. Its also being loaded in the file server too. The problem is when I delete my cache and go to download a fresh one, it downloads and loads fine up to the login screen. When you hit login its stuck at “Please allow a few moments for the region to download.” I can’t figure out why this is happening. I’ve packed the crc and versionlist for the index in versionlist.dat and i’ve found that Texture.java is communicating with it through ondemand found here: updateManager.method558(4, id); which requests files as 4 is the newest data block. If anyone could help me figure this out, i’d forever be in your favor.

Read full topic
item.source: Adding New Index to File Server
